Name: @panorama_transition_time_factor
Description: A float representing a scale factor for transitions. 1.0 is normal, 2.0 would be twice as fast as normal, 0.5 half as fast

Name: _fov
Description: Automates fov command to server.

Name: _record
Description: Record a demo incrementally.

Name: _resetgamestats
Description: Erases current game stats and writes out a blank stats file

Name: achievement_debug
Description: Turn on achievement debug msgs.

Name: achievement_disable
Description: Turn off achievements.

Name: addip
Description: Add an IP address to the ban list.

Name: addons
Description: list current addon info.

Name: ai_animgraph_lerp_movement_yaw
Description: If set, forces animgraph-using NPCs to lerp their movement yaw.

Name: ai_clear_bad_links
Description: Clears bits set on nav links indicating link is unusable

Name: ai_debug_dyninteractions
Description: Debug the NPC dynamic interaction system.

Name: ai_debug_enemy_position
Description: Draw a debug line from a selected NPC to its enemy.

Name: ai_debug_expressions
Description: Show random expression decisions for NPCs.

Name: ai_debug_looktargets
Description: Debug looktarget logic for NPCs selected with 'npc_select'. Options: ai_debug_looktargets 1 - Show current looktarget. ai_debug_looktargets 2 - Show eye target selections. ai_debug_looktargets 3 - Show nearby world inspection & selection.

Name: ai_debug_los
Description: NPC Line-Of-Sight debug mode. If 1, solid entities that block NPC LOC will be highlighted with white bounding boxes. If 2, it'll show non-solid entities that would do it if they were solid.

Name: ai_debug_node_connect
Description: Debug the attempted connection between two nodes

Name: ai_disable
Description: Bi-passes all AI logic routines and puts all NPCs into their idle animations.  Can be used to get NPCs out of your way and to test effect of AI logic routines on frame rate

Name: ai_drop_hint
Description: Drop an ai_hint at the player's current eye position.

Name: ai_expression_frametime
Description: Maximum frametime to still play background expressions.

Name: ai_expression_optimization
Description: Disable npc background expressions when you can't see them.

Name: ai_frametime_limit
Description: frametime limit for min efficiency AIE_NORMAL (in sec's).

Name: ai_hull
Description: Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used  Arguments: NPC name or classname, <none>=NPC under crosshair

Name: ai_navigator_repath_on_change
Description: When nav mesh changes along an NPC's existing path, force a repath.

Name: ai_navigator_repath_tolerance_alpha
Description: The distance a target entity can move before triggering a repath is ( arrival time * ai_navigator_repath_tolerance_alpha ), clamped to the min / max allowed values.

Name: ai_navigator_repath_tolerance_max
Description: The maximum distance that a target entity can move before triggering a repath to that target.

Name: ai_navigator_repath_tolerance_min
Description: The minimum distance that a target entity can move before triggering a repath to that target.

Name: ai_navigator_repath_tolerance_min_speed
Description: When calculating repathing tolerance, clamp entity speed to be at least this value (i.e. consider slow entities to be this fast).

Name: ai_next_hull
Description: Cycles through the various hull sizes.  Currently selected hull size is written to the screen.  Controls which connections are shown when ai_show_hull or ai_show_connect commands are used  Arguments: -none-

Name: ai_no_select_box
Description: Don't draw bounding box of selected NPCs. ( 0 = selection box, 1 = no selection box, 2 = small selection cross instead)

Name: ai_nodes
Description: Toggles node display.  First call displays the nodes for the given network as green objects.  Second call  displays the nodes and their IDs.  Nodes are color coded as follows:  Green  - ground node  Cyan  - air node  Magenta - climb node  Grey  - node not available for selected hull size  Orange  - node currently locked

Name: ai_path_draw
Description: Number of seconds to draw an AI path after it is calculated.  Path type comes from ai_path_debug_type.

Name: ai_path_draw_active
Description: 0 = no debug, 1 = draw waypoint path, 2 = draw nav path

Name: ai_path_draw_fail
Description: Draw failed pathfinding attempts

Name: ai_path_draw_selected
Description: If true, draw AI path for selected NPC.  Path type comes from ai_path_debug_type.

Name: ai_path_draw_type
Description: 0 = waypoint path, 1 = nav path (before converted to waypoints)

Name: ai_path_draw_waypoint_mark
Description: 0: Draw nothing at waypoints; 1: Draw a tick mark at waypoints; 2: Draw a box around waypoints.

Name: ai_path_draw_yaw
Description: Display yaw value for path goal.

Name: ai_resume
Description: If NPC is stepping through tasks (see ai_step ) will resume normal processing.

Name: ai_select_box_alpha
Description: The select box alpha.

Name: ai_set_move_height_epsilon
Description: Set how high AI bumps up ground walkers when checking steps

Name: ai_setenabled
Description: Like ai_disable but you manually specify the state (with a 0 or 1) instead of toggling it.

Name: ai_show_connect
Description: Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:  Green  - ground movement   Blue  - jumping movement  Cyan  - flying movement    Yellow  - crawling movement  Magenta - climbing movement  Red  - connection disabled

Name: ai_show_connect_crawl
Description: Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:  Green  - ground movement   Blue  - jumping movement  Cyan  - flying movement  Yellow  - crawling movement  Magenta - climbing movement  Red  - connection disabled

Name: ai_show_connect_fly
Description: Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:  Green  - ground movement   Blue  - jumping movement  Cyan  - flying movement    Yellow  - crawling movement  Magenta - climbing movement  Red  - connection disabled

Name: ai_show_connect_jump
Description: Displays the allowed connections between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:  Green  - ground movement   Blue  - jumping movement  Cyan  - flying movement    Yellow  - crawling movement  Magenta - climbing movement  Red  - connection disabled

Name: ai_show_graph_connect
Description: Toggles graph connection display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are connected to the selected node by the net graph will be drawn in red with magenta lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not connected via the net graph from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

Name: ai_show_grid
Description: Draw a grid on the floor where looking.

Name: ai_show_hints
Description: Displays all hints as small boxes  Blue  - hint is available for use  Red  - hint is currently being used by an NPC  Orange  - hint not being used by timed out  Grey  - hint has been disabled

Name: ai_show_hull
Description: Displays the allowed hulls between each node for the currently selected hull type.  Hulls are color code as follows:  Green  - ground movement   Blue  - jumping movement  Cyan  - flying movement    Yellow  - crawling movement  Magenta - climbing movement  Arguments:  -none-

Name: ai_show_hull_attacks
Description: Show AI hull traces for melee attacks. 1 = show them for attacks, 2 = show them for tests.

Name: ai_show_node
Description: Highlight the specified node

Name: ai_show_visibility
Description: Toggles visibility display for the node that the player is looking at.  Nodes that are visible from the selected node will be drawn in red with yellow lines connecting to the selected node.  Nodes that are not visible from the selected node will be drawn in blue.

Name: ai_step
Description: NPCs will freeze after completing their current task.  To complete the next task, use 'ai_step' again.  To resume processing normally use 'ai_resume'

Name: ai_test_los_from_player_pov

Name: cl_class

Name: cl_clearhinthistory
Description: Clear memory of client side hints displayed to the player.

Name: cl_clock_correction
Description: Enable/disable clock correction on the client.

Name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_amount
Description: Sets the maximum number of milliseconds per second it is allowed to correct the client clock. It will only correct this amount if the difference between the client and server clock is equal to or larger than cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_offset.

Name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_offset
Description: As the clock offset goes from cl_clock_correction_adjustment_min_offset to this value (in milliseconds), it moves towards applying cl_clock_correction_adjustment_max_amount of adjustment. That way, the response is small when the offset is small.

Name: cl_clock_correction_adjustment_min_offset
Description: If the clock offset is less than this amount (in milliseconds), then no clock correction is applied.

Name: cl_clock_correction_force_server_tick
Description: Force clock correction to match the server tick + this offset (-999 disables it).

Name: cl_clock_showdebuginfo
Description: Show debugging info about the clock drift.

Name: cl_clockdrift_max_ms
Description: Maximum number of milliseconds the clock is allowed to drift before the client snaps its clock to the server's.

Name: cl_clockdrift_max_ms_threadmode
Description: Maximum number of milliseconds the clock is allowed to drift before the client snaps its clock to the server's.

Name: cl_cmdrate
Description: Max number of command packets sent to server per second

Name: cl_connectionretrytime_p2p
Description: Number of seconds over which to spread retry attempts for P2P.

Name: cl_consistencycheck_interval

Name: cl_customsounds

Name: cl_debug_player_use

Name: cl_debugoverlay_toggle
Description: Toggles visibility of the debug overlay system.

Name: cl_demo_steadycam_blendframes

Name: cl_demo_steadycam_deflection

Name: cl_demo_steadycam_enable

Name: cl_demo_steadycam_radius
Description: if camera moves this much from last anchor update anchor

Name: cl_demo_view_offset_left
Description: View offset during demo playback (+/- 1.25 is a good default for human average left/right eye offset)

Name: cl_demoviewoverride

Name: cl_ent_actornames

Name: cl_ent_clear_debug_overlays
